text: Hi, my name is Owen.

I'm a principal telecom
solutions architect from
Amazon Web Services.

This demo is all about
how AWS is bringing Telco,
who are monetizing the network APIs
and the developer ecosystem.

Together we have our telco
customers from Indonesia,
Xcel X iata, and in Ordo Hutchinson.

They are actively developing
the network API products.

And they want to make
this product reach many
of the developers in Indonesia,

but they don't have the
traditional developer reach.

On the other hand, we
also have developers such
as Terra Logic in Indonesia.
They're always looking for ways

to improve the user
experience of their product
by getting more insights from the network.

But in the past they have
to go to individual telcos
to negotiate agreements
and you know, set up API connections.

So how a WS is helping in
this case is we partner
with ATA Digital Lab,

which develop a very innovative
API federation platform
called the Synergy API Portal.

Through this portal, developers
like TE Logic will be able
to subscribe,

consume network APIs from
multiple telcos in Indonesia,

and they can access
these network APIs in a
very seamless way.
AWS is focused on

not just facilitating the
exposure of these network APIs
by working with API Federation platform,

but we are also focusing on
helping developers combining
network APIs

and other AWS cloud services
to create meaningful use cases.

So the demo itself is a
very simple demo here,
as you can see from the architecture,
we have the network APIs from Excel, xta,
and Indo Hutchinson.

They're being exposed through
the API Federation platform,
which is hosted on AWS.
Developers like TE Logic will be able

to consume from this API
Federation platform in order

for them to complete
a meaningful use case.
They will also need other capabilities
beyond just the network API itself.
In this example demo,

we are helping TE Logic
enhance the digital security

of their mobile FinTech
mobile application.

optical character recognition

we help TE Logic create a
meaningful secure FinTech
application for the end users.

where user log into a mobile app as part

of the user workflow, such
as new user account signup
or credit approval.

The mobile application
will invoke an API call
to the Synergy API platform.

And then based on the
response of the API core,

we can determine whether
the user application is
secure or not.
So this is an example of the mobile,
the FinTech mobile application.
So here we are simulating a user flow
of a new credit application process.

As you can see, as a user who
is applying for a mortgage,

they're required to provide
the tax number, the income
among the marital status,
and more importantly the mobile number.

As part of this credit application
workflow, users required
to provide their identity card,

and this is where Amazon
tax track is used,
where we will extract tax information such
as the user ID from the card,

and we'll also extract the

And then once we extract the
information from the user ID

card, we ask the user to do

facial rec verification is
successful in Dick's case.

In the typical workflow,
the user will receive an
S-M-S-O-T-P to confirm their identity.

What we are showing in this
case is if this specific mobile
number was subject

to a Sims swap attack based
on the Sims swap API response,

we would detect that this
device is no longer secure

and we will not approve
the user application.

So here you see an error
notification is sent back

to the user notifying that
the SIM card has been swapped
and you know, further actions will need
to be taken by the user.

They either have to go
to an office in person
or contact the mobile operator.

So this is just a very simple
demo to show how network APIs

and AWS cloud services
comes together to create

a meaningful use case for a
FinTech mobile application.
